website_summaries.verdict: With its waterproofing, comfort level, and fit nothing short of excellent, the Zamberlan 996 Vioz GTX is hard not to like. Add to those good points the boot’s superbly grippy outsole, and wearers would have virtually no reason to skip on it—except, perhaps, its alleged lack of breathability which some users whose feet sweat a lot might utterly dislike.Overall, the 996 Vioz GTX doesn’t mess around with its set of positive qualities. That said, those who are very particular with ample ventilation in their footwear might benefit from getting a completely different boot.
pros: Numerous owners found the 996 Vioz GTX’s waterproofing beyond outstanding
Nearly everyone who bought this Zamberlan boot swore by its exceptional comfort
About half of the reviewing population gave the footwear aces for its true-to-size fit
The Zamberlan 996 Vioz GTX received praises from several users for having top-notch traction
Some testers were astounded by the boot’s flexible collar
Less than a handful of reviewers greatly admired the gear’s fantastic design
A couple of owners loved the lasting durability of the 996 Vioz GTX
This boot helped a very small number of users conquer challenging hikes with as much arch support as possible
cons: About a handful of hikers found the boot’s ventilation quite insufficient
A tiny fraction of consumer reviews called out the Zamberlan 996 Vioz GTX for lacking dependable debris protection

customer_reviews.title: In hindsight the Vioz Plus model would have been better option for the kind of walk I do
customer_reviews.text: I have now been wearing these boots on 6 occasions on 10-12 km mountain walks and I found that the front of the boots are scuffed badly immediately after my first walk. Ideally the rubber at the front should go up an inch higher to protect the leather. In hindsight the Vioz Plus model would have been better option for the kind of walk I do. I walked in boggy wet ground and in rough terrain and these pair are reliably waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Noodles

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely fantastic. I bought 8 different pairs of boots to try on - all different brands and prices. These were the most expensive but the ones I ended up keeping. They ooze quality and have a lovely bounce to them when you walk. Felt comfy from the off can't recommend them enough. I'm a size 7 shoe and the smallest size of these which is 7.5 fit me perfectly with a thick sock.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Davies

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing boots, my second pair of these, i couldn't pass up the opertunity to buy another pair before they stop making them, I have had my first pair for almost 3 years and they are in fantastic condition still, moderate to heavy use. Love love these.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Rundell

customer_reviews.title: A superb heavy-duty boot
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of Zamberlan boots for many years - this is my 5th pair, although the first of this model. They were comfortable straight out of the box and, as always with Zamberlan, needed no 'breaking in'. What I particularly like about the 996 Vioz is the one-piece upper, so reducing the potential for leaking seams in the years to come. If they wear as well as my previous pairs, they will keep my feet dry and comfortable for a long time
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and performance
customer_reviews.text: Great boot, been out for short and long walks with the Vioz on, performance has been excellent. I was particularly after good grip, having had problems with some of the latest Salomon's in this respect. Grip was very good last weekend on wet stone/grass, terrain which has seen me slip badly with Salomon boots. Note on sizing - I'm 6'3" and approx 14 st, usually take a 9, ordered 9.5 and they fit great. Zamberlan say they are true to size and that seems to be the case. Perhaps a little narrow for some, but no problems for me.
customer_reviews.author: A. R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good boots spoiled by cheeper material's
customer_reviews.text: Quallity has gone down since the original pair i bought 4 years ago thiner leather and less fine detail all round
customer_reviews.author: James p

customer_reviews.title: A thing of beauty!
customer_reviews.text: Quality boots. I usually wear size 11 - for these size 12 fit well. Quite a narrow boot and after walking for a while I can feel the outside of my little toes against the boot - however this isn't a major problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: JamesC

customer_reviews.title: Best. Boots Ever?
customer_reviews.text: A little more expensive than my Brasher boots but the Zamberlan 996 Vioz are in a different class. I took the advise from other comments to get a half size up from the normal and the boots fit perfectly. Very comfortable out of the box, extremely well made and whilst I have only used them for a few hours think they will probably withstand everything chucked at them and outlast the Meindle boots of which I have worn out three pairs. Take my advise and invest if you can run to the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Walks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots after reading the customer reviews, and I'm glad I did. Very comfortable fit, though I did go a size bigger than what I take. Good boot for people whose feet are narrow. So far have been great walking in the winter snows and wet or dry ground. Can't fault the boots in any way. A good buy with the usual quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mccarron

customer_reviews.title: ... so went up a size and the 9 is perfect also went for the 996 viol gt this time ...
customer_reviews.text: My first pair were 8 but they were tight on my feet so went up a size and the 9 is perfect also went for the 996 viol gt this time and have done two walks so far a 6ml walk and a 12 ml walk and no problems at all, just started walking with them straight out the box.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas&Sandra Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Very good walking boot.
customer_reviews.text: These are the second pair that I have bought. The first pair lasted over 8 years and proved to be very good over the rougher terrain of Snowdonia. I am hoping to enjoy many more forays into the hills With this new pair.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic boots. Had scrapa for years a these are far better quality and look great too in black
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Higginbottom

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Zamberlan is the best brand for me. I had 3 pairs of shoes in the past. Doing what you paid for
customer_reviews.author: Domantas

customer_reviews.title: Great boot as expected
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable from previous boots ive only used them on the mountains once. Still great as an every day boot aswell.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: ... in this world so I went for the charcoal love them came on time great expectation
customer_reviews.text: I searched the world for Black in a 8 uk not in this world so I went for the charcoal love them came on time great expectation
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very nice and well made boot
customer_reviews.text: very nice and well made boot, but could not get the comfort due to narrow fitting. swapped for the light weight version which are not as rigid but very comfy over distance and terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Hu at 48

customer_reviews.title: zamberlan boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are excellent :- Well made Waterproof ( unlike most other boots ) Easy to put on and take off because of the lacing arrangement Comfortable immediately They are very expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.author: sapiens

customer_reviews.title: these were replacing a pair of the same boots. ...
customer_reviews.text: these were replacing a pair of the same boots . bought for comfort only observation would be that moulded soles are not as robust as they could be.
customer_reviews.author: mike lewis

customer_reviews.title: absolutely awesome boots! straight out the box they were immediately ...
customer_reviews.text: absolutely awesome boots! straight out the box they were immediately comfy and after a ten miler there were no hassles at all. Actually forgot all about them which is always a good sign!
customer_reviews.author: ash

customer_reviews.title: Butifully made boots
customer_reviews.text: Spoke to seller, got sum advice on fit was helpful boot are butifully made and feel top quality not took them out yet but I'm impressed
customer_reviews.author: Garry sands

customer_reviews.title: then a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Remember the sizing is USA and a bit smaller than UK, so order a bigger size for UK sizes, then a perfect fit.....
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: These are my second of Zamberlans and they have not disappointed, Sure, they are expensive but in my opinion they are worth every penny. I looked at severall different boots but these are in a different league.
customer_reviews.author: martin waters

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have not walked in anger yet but they look great and fell fine 😊
customer_reviews.author: david keir

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit
customer_reviews.text: Tried these boots - excellent manufacture - but the sizing is small & narrow! Had to return them - Amazon free delivery & free return is an excellent feature! So is the "nowget20" discount with 20% off the final price. Get the next 1/2 or full size up from your normal boot.
customer_reviews.author: Steven P. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great boots if you give them some TLC
customer_reviews.text: Just bought 2nd pair. First lasted 3 years. I work in the countryside and wore them pretty much 5 days a week, 10 months a year in all weathers. Good support, grip and waterproofing. Still some life in them but just wanted a 2nd pair in the cupboard, ready to go when needed. Yes the fit is narrow but so what? Just size up. Like all leather boots, key to long life would seem to be regular cleaning and waxing. Never really trust Gortex, but the leather is good quality and reasonably thick. Minimal seams also a big plus. Can't see myself buying anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic pair of boots, no breaking in needed, extremely well made, ordered 1/2 size larger than normal, very happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Nev

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very good and sturdy they fit a bit on the small size. If you have a wide foot then I would recommend you try before you buy. I found these boots do need a little braking in. But a good build boot for all train.
customer_reviews.author: malcolm hornby

customer_reviews.title: Zamberlan boots, Simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: For me personally I think they're the best boot on the market. No need bed them in, it's like putting on a pair of slippers straight from the box.
customer_reviews.author: GKMC

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant boots for all types of walker
customer_reviews.text: The Vioz GT are really excellent boots. The GT lining makes them waterproof so they are definitely an all weather walking boot. The sole provides plenty of grip whatever the surface and the full leather upper will last for years if well maintained. These boots are worth the money and should be treated like an investment - a good pair of boots like this should be resoled when needed so you needn't buy a new pair as often. My day-to-day shoe size is a 9 so I went for the 9.5 and they fit like a dream with walking socks.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Boots
customer_reviews.text: This is my husbands 3 pair of these boots, they are extremely comfortable hard wearing & keeps his feet super dry.
customer_reviews.author: linda ann mcchrystal

customer_reviews.title: however the padding around the top of the boot has failed resulting in rubbing of my ankles rendering the boots useless. I guess
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots 16 months ago,considering the price i had hoped for slightly more sole life from the boot. The uppers have never let in any water,however the padding around the top of the boot has failed resulting in rubbing of my ankles rendering the boots useless. I guess these boots have done around 2000 miles,which concerns me as my previous boots lasted far longer.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

product_meta.title: Zamberlan Men's 996 Vioz Gore-tex® Walking Boot
product_meta.description: Ideal for tough backpacking with heavy loads. The main areas you want your walking boot to perform are in the upper where you need weatherproofing and a comfortable fit and in the outsole where traction and stability are a must. The Zamberlan Vioz GTX Mens Walking Boots deliver in each of these areas - and more. The upper is constructed with a full grain leather that has been treat with Hydrobloc coating. Hydrobloc is a trademark registered by Zamberlan to identify only the best quality leathers, which are tanned following a special treatment that enhances the water-repellence, resistance and durability. This combination of full grain leather and hydrobloc offers superb comfort, climate control and added water-repellence. Full grain leather is extremely strong and hard wearing, it is also very durable with proper care and maintenance. As opposed to synthetic materials, full grain leather also moulds to your foot ensuring an excellent fit. The upper also features patented Z. F. S (Zamberlan Flex-STM) this describes the unique multidirectional joint that offers great lateral support, comfort and freedom of movement of the ankle and overall stability. What this means is the boot will bend and flex in the correct places while giving lots of lateral support when traversing and on steep and rough terrain. Also forming part the upper are a Gore-Tex Performance lining and Z. A. S (Zamberlan Air System). Gore-Tex Performance lining offers a range of benefits the main ones being it is durably waterproof, highly breathable, protective in the outdoors as well as being fast drying. Z. A. S is Zamberlan's special construction and design method, combined with the best components to optimize comfort and breathability. Boots crafted accordingly are extremely light weight and very breathable. The outsole of the Vioz GTX walking boots is constructed with a Zamberlan Vibram 3D outsole. This consists of 7 areas that combine for excellent traction, durability and comfort. 1-Low density PU mi
feature_bullets: Winner of the Country Walking 3-season boot Test
Flex System heel hinge for extra support and comfort
A tough walking boot with great comfort
Zamberlan Hydrobloc Full Grain Leather with Gore-tex lining
